Key Match Events: Germany scored five goals against Scotland in their Euro 2024 opener
Scotland's Ryan Porteous was sent off for a two-footed challenge on Ilkay Gundogan
Kai Havertz scored a penalty after the VAR review led to Porteous's red card
Post-Match Reflections: Germany coach Julian Nagelsmann spoke of his players' hunger to atone for the failures of recent times
Scotland coach Steve Clarke urged Scotland to 'fear no one' going into the country's second straight Euros
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was Germany's first men's major tournament as hosts since the 2006 World Cup
Others: Germany's Thomas Müller, Jamal Musiala, Niclas Füllkrug, and Emre Can scored goals for Germany
Scotland's goal was an own goal by Antonio Rüdiger
